details.title: Counting of votes in the 5 constituencies has begun
details.content:
#KarnatakaBypolls2018: Counting of votes begins at counting centres in Bellary and Shimoga Lok Sabha constituencies, pic.twitter.com/J9syo6wsRQ

— ANI (@ANI) November 6, 2018

details.title: It’s almost a certain win for JD(S)’ Anitha Kumaraswamy in Ramanagara
details.content: It could a walkover in Ramanagara for the JD(S)-Congress combined candidate Anitha Kumaraswamy, wife of the Chief Minister, especially after BJP’s Chandrashekar withdrew from the contest and joined the Congress.

details.title: Clash of the CMs' sons in Shivamogga
details.content: In Shivamogga, BJP state president B S Yeddyurappa’s son B Y Raghavendra is testing his fortunes against another former chief minister S Bangarappa’s son Madhu Bangarappa of the JD(S).

details.title: Battle for Ballari
details.content: Senior BJP leader Sriramulu’s sister J Shantha is fighting against V S Ugrappa of the Congress, considered an outsider, but strongly backed by party leaders Siddaramaiah and D K Shivakumar.

details.title: A crucial test for Congress-JD(s) against BJP
details.content: Though the Congress-JD(S) alliance is sure of winning the Mandya parliamentary seat, the BJP hopes to gain its vote share. An increase in vote share is all that the party needs to boost the cadre and capitalise on the infighting with the Congress-JD(S) workers in the run up to the 2019 Lok Sabha polls.

details.title: Nyamagowda for Jamkhandi?
details.content: In Jamkhandi, it remains to be seen whether Congress’ Anand Nyamagowda will be able to make his successful electoral debut, riding on the sympathy wave due to death of his father and former MLA Siddu Nyamagouda, by defeating Srikant Kulkarni of the BJP.

details.title: High stakes in Mandya
details.content: In the Vokkaliga bastion of Mandya, JD(S)’s L R Shivarame Gowda, is pitted against a fresh face in Dr Siddaramaiah from the BJP.

details.title: A crucial test for Congress-JD(s) against BJP
details.content: Though the Congress-JD(S) alliance is sure of winning the Mandya parliamentary seat, the BJP hopes to gain its vote share. An increase in vote share is all that the party needs to boost the cadre and capitalise on the infighting with the Congress-JD(S) workers in the run up to the 2019 Lok Sabha polls.

District Election Office deployed strong men surrounding to Mini Vidhan Soudha in Jamkhandi. The counting of postal ballot has started. @avinbhat @NewIndianXpress #karnatakaelectionresults2018 #KarnatakaBypolls #karnatakaelectionresults2018 pic.twitter.com/uMZA6sXkiw

— Mahesh M Goudar (@GMahesh_TNIE) November 6, 2018

details.title: Jamkhandi: Congress 10,882 | BJP 7097
details.content: After the completion of the second round of counting, Congress takes a lead of 3,785 votes against BJP.

details.title: Jamkhandi: INC's Anand Nayamgouda leads
details.content:
Congress' Anand Nayamgouda continues with a lead of 3785 votes after the end of the second round of counting.

Anand Nayamgouda: INC: 10,882

Srikanth Kulkarni: BJP: 7097

NOTA: 66
Shivamogga: Initial trends suggest a marginal lead by BJP candidate B Y Raghavendra over coalition candidate Madhu Bangarappa.

Ramanagaram: JDS candidate and wife of Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy, Anitha, has polled 10,241 votes. The contest in Ramanagaram is largely on paper as the trailing candidate, L Chandrashekar of the BJP, had retired from the contest and joined the Congress. He has polled 1811 votes so far out of 28 booths in 2 rounds of voting.

details.title: Ballari: Congress' Ugrappa leads
details.content: Ballari: Congress candidate VS Ugrappa's lead over J Shanta of the BJP grows to 31138. Ugrappa after two rounds of counting in 224 out of 1901 booths, has 74668 votes compared to 43530 for Shanta. Around 875 votes have been cast under the 'NOTA' option.

details.title: Ramanagaram: Anitha Kumaraswamy polls 10, 241 votes
details.content: JDS candidate and wife of Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy, Anitha, has polled 10,241 votes. The contest in Ramanagaram is largely on paper as the trailing candidate, L Chandrashekar of the BJP, had retired from the contest and joined the Congress. He has polled 1811 votes so far out of 28 booths in 2 rounds of voting.

details.title: Shivamogga: BJP sees marginal lead
details.content: Initial trends suggest a marginal lead by BJP candidate B Y Raghavendra over coalition candidate Madhu Bangarappa.

details.title: The Congress is now leading in 2 seats (Ballari and Jamkhandi) while the JDS is leading in Ramanagaram. Early trends suggest the BJP has a massive fight on its hands as it is trailing in 3 out of 5 seats that went to polls.
details.content: Congress candidate Anand Nayamagouda visiting a voting block in Jamkhandi.

details.title: JDS leads in Mandya
details.content: JDS Candidate Shivrame Gowda leads in Mandya by over 40,000 votes. Presently, Shivamogga is the BJP's only saving grace as BY Raghavendra leads by a small margin of around 6000 votes.

details.title: 10 AM Update: Congress leads 4 seats, BJP leads in Shivamogga
details.content: At 10 am, with several rounds of counting completed across all five seats, the BJP has managed to maintain a slender lead only in Shivamogga with the JDS-Congress combine leading in all other seats. In Ballari, Congress candidate VS Ugrappa could very well pull off the largest win in the bypolls as his lead balloons to over 1 lakh votes.

Congress candidate Anand Nayamgouda reacts to the media after the completion of 9 rounds of counting. He expects victory with a lead of 35,000 votes @avinbhat @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/cEyEqqz5mn

— Mahesh M Goudar (@GMahesh_TNIE) November 6, 2018

details.title: Congress takes huge lead in Ballari
details.content: Ballari might well turn out to be the biggest win for the Congress as its candidate VS Ugrappa increases his lead to 64,000 votes after the 4th round of counting concludes.

Congress candidate Anand Nayamgouda poses victory symbol along with party workers in minividhansoudha at Jamkhandi currently he is in lead of 36,000 votes only two rounds left for the final announcement @avinbhat @NewIndianXpress #KarnatakaByElection2018Results pic.twitter.com/PAfrUlkm9W

— Mahesh M Goudar (@GMahesh_TNIE) November 6, 2018

details.title: Former CM Siddaramaiah on Ballari results
details.content: People of Ballari have cursed BJP's G Janardhana Reddy for his inhuman behaviour, says Siddaramaiah.

details.title: JDS supremo Deve Gowda thanks people
details.content: Deve Gowda says: "I thank people of Karnataka for supporting development-centric administration of JDS-INC Government. People of the state have given their response to those who were trying to destabilise the state Government."

details.title: Karnataka Congress chief Dinesh Gundu Rao reacts
details.content:
Resounding win for the @INCIndia & @JanataDal_S coalition in Karnataka. 4-1 thrashing to BJP.
People have rejected the negative politics of BJP in Karnataka and the abject failure of Modi govt in addressing people’s issues.
Congrats to all the winners.

— Dinesh Gundu Rao (@dineshgrao) November 6, 2018

details.title: Congress celebrates in Ballari
details.content:
Karnataka: Congress workers celebrate outside the counting station in Bellary. Congress' candidate VS Ugrappa is leading by 184203 votes in the parliamentary seat. #KarnatakaByElection2018 pic.twitter.com/4y6l9ZqY8j

— ANI (@ANI) November 6, 2018

details.title: Congress candidate Anand Nayamgouda officially announced as winner in Jamkhandi; wins by a margin of 39,482 votes
details.content:
Congress candidate Anand Nayamgouda dedicates his victory to his father and former minister late Siddu Nayamgouda. He says it is one of the biggest Diwali gift of his life. This win has increased my responsibilities said Anand @avinbhat @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/Be12QxfbM7

— Mahesh M Goudar (@GMahesh_TNIE) November 6, 2018

details.title: Congress leader DK Shivakumar on bypoll results
details.content: "While all rounds of counting have not been completed, in politics, nothing is certain. But in Ballari, I was given responsibility for Ballari. I had accepted the responsibility gladly. I want to thank the voters, for voting by forgetting caste, religion and other such factors. Ugrappa will work for the people and he had assured them of the same, that is why they voted him in. We are not overconfident by our victory. Sriramulu suggested a TV debate, I was ready to show up with notice, he didn't come. I want to thank all political workers,including those from the BJP for their support in these elections."

Karnataka: JD(S) workers celebrate in Ramanagaram. JDS' Anitha Kumaraswamy is leading by 1,00,246 votes in the assembly seat. Congress-JD(S) alliance is leading on 4 out of 5 seats in #KarnatakaByElection2018 pic.twitter.com/4s1RAZ6vfU

— ANI (@ANI) November 6, 2018

details.title: Congress' DK Shivakumar reacts:
details.content:
I think as far as southern India is concerned, you can't make Ram Mandir & all those issues a political plank. People are looking at what they're going to get, what benefit they're going to get in social&economic sector, admn&transparency: DK Shivakumar #KarnatakaByElection2018 pic.twitter.com/DMLtgNvOYM

— ANI (@ANI) November 6, 2018
JD(S)' Anitha Kumaraswamy wins Ramanagara assembly seat with a margin of 109137 votes.

— Prakash Raj (@prakashraaj) November 6, 2018

details.title: Jamkhandi's BJP candidate alleges Congress bribed voters
details.content:
BJP representative Srikanth Kulkarni alleges on Congress leaders for his defeat. He says they bribed the officials and lured voters with money. We will stage a strike against the district election commission, stated Srikanth @avinbhat @NewIndianXpress #KarnatakaBypollResults pic.twitter.com/EBaN2lS0zO

— Mahesh M Goudar (@GMahesh_TNIE) November 6, 2018
Congress-JD(S) alliance wins 4 out of 5 seats: Ballari, Mandya, Ramanagara and Jamkhandi. BJP wins Shivamogga assembly seat.

details.title: BJP is offering around Rs 25-30 crore to some Congress and JD(S) MLAs but they will never be able to poach them: HD Kumaraswamy
details.content:
This elections was the first step. There are 28 LS seats, we'll work with Congress to win all of them, that is our goal.This is not an empty boast just because we have won today. This is the confidence of people in us. This win is not making us arrogant: JD(S) leader&Karnataka CM pic.twitter.com/g4QF3oRooh

— ANI (@ANI) November 6, 2018

details.title: Here are reactions to the bypoll results
details.content:
Vote in favour of coalition government, says Congress; BJP to introspect reasons for its poor show

details.title: (LR) Anitha Kumaraswamy of the JD(S) won Ramanagaram; Congress’ VS Ugrappa won Ballari; INC"s Anand Nayamagouda won Jamkhandi; JD(S)’s LR Shivaramegowda won Mandya and BJP’s BY Raghavendra won Shivamogga.
